HOP.NAME: 92P24 2015
HOP.NOTES:
Experimental SAB hop. No data.
"Bittering hop with and alpha of ±14.5%"

HOP.NAME: Admiral
HOP.NOTES: Bittering hops derived from Wye Challenger. Good high-alpha bittering hops. Used for: Ales Aroma: Primarily for bittering Substitutes: Target, Northdown, Challenger

HOP.NAME: African Queen
HOP.NOTES: A high alpha hop from South Africa with interesting bittering potential and fruity flavors. Fruity aroma includes hints of blueberry, cassis, passion fruit, citrus, stone fruit, black currant, tea, lemongrass and even chili. Can be used both for bittering and as a late addition.

HOP.NAME: African Queen 2017
HOP.NOTES:
African Queen is a South African bred high alpha, daylight neutral hop whose pedigree is a diploid seedling selected from a cross between 91J7/25 and an SA male 94US2/118. The aroma profile includes dank, blueberries, stone fruit, black currant, gooseberries, bubble gum, lemongrass, and chilies. Total oil content is around 1.3 percent, alpha acids range from 12 to 17 percent, and cohumulone is low at about 26 percent. Works well with all hop-forward beers, including American and Belgian styles. Also works well with subtle blended beers such as those with coffee, fruit, and spices. Possible similar hops: Mosaic, Simcoe, Citra.
Experimental SAB hop. J17/63 is a day neutral high alpha variety, which requires moderate planting distances and an average of 9-10000 strings and 27-30000 bines per hectare. Bines are vigorous and perform well on a standard framework. The medium sized cones with an average volume of 0.24g are semi tight, dense and pick very easily. The cone to leaf ratio is 60:40. Alpha development is normal.
Because of the excellent alpha acids content and good yields, J17/63 gives a very high alpha acid production per hectare.
Cohumulone 26.5%, Storeability (Pellets) TBC, Isomerisation (Pellets) TBC, Total Oil ml/100g 1.3%, Humulene 21.4%, Caryophyllene 12.8%, Hum/Car Ratio 1.7, Farnesene 4.9, Myrcene 28.4%

HOP.NOTES:
African Queen is a South African bred high alpha, daylight neutral hop whose pedigree is a diploid seedling selected from a cross between 91J7/25 and an SA male 94US2/118. The aroma profile includes dank, blueberries, stone fruit, black currant, gooseberries, bubble gum, lemongrass, and chilies.
